translation: 第一莫哈维储蓄银行一一经理终端
个人日志 - 严禁外传
食谱：大厨库克的魔鬼炖肉
死去的营养不良的死亡爪

original:
Oct 19th, 2077

Just to let you know. Mr. Givens left a key with me today. I’ll be holding onto it here at the front office until it’s picked up again. He seemed a little anxious when he dropped it off, like he was in a hurry for it to be kept out sight.

Daniel Ruiz - Day shift clerk
translation:
2077年10月19日

只是想让你知道。吉文斯先生今天给我留了一把钥匙。我会在前台保管它，直到它再次被取走。当吉文斯先生放下钥匙时，他似乎有点焦虑，好像他觉得离钥匙越远越好。

丹尼尔·鲁伊斯 - 日班职员

original:
HR Department

Corporate Employee Review Records - First Mojave Savings, North Las Vegas Branch

Name: Harold E. Givens
Position: Branch Manager
Address: 1040 Palisades Ave, Las Vegas, NV
Notes: With the company since 2063. Known for his meticulous bookkeeping and “old-fashioned” customer service. Rumored to personally inspect the vault every morning before opening.

Name: Sandra K. Doolin
Position: Head Teller
Address: 312 Sierra Vista Dr, Henderson, NV
Notes: Has worked at the bank for 14 years. Keeps a small collection of Nuka-Cola bottles on her desk. Frequently requests time off during October for the Kingman County Fair.

Name: Maria Velasquez
Position: Loan Officer
Address: 220 West Caliente Blvd, Las Vegas, NV
Notes: Commutes. Has a habit of leaving her coffee mug on the counter by the vault door, despite repeated reminders.
translation:
人事档案
第一莫哈维储蓄银行 - 北拉斯维加斯分行员工评估记录

姓名： 哈罗德·E·吉文斯
职位： 分行经理
住址： 拉斯维加斯市帕利塞兹大道1040号
备注： 自2063年起任职于本行。以细致入微的账目管理与"老派"客户服务风格著称。据传每日开业前会亲自巡查金库。

姓名： 桑德拉·K·杜林
职位： 高级柜员
住址： 亨德森市西埃拉维斯塔大道312号
备注： 在行任职14年。办公桌收藏有系列核子可乐瓶。每年十月频繁申请休假前往金曼郡集市。

姓名： 玛丽亚·维拉斯奎兹
职位： 信贷专员
住址： 拉斯维加斯市西卡连特大道220号
备注： 通勤上班。习惯将咖啡杯遗落在金库门旁柜台，经多次提醒仍未改正。

original:
[Oct 22, 2077]

Subject: Freight Still Missing

No sign of the priority car. It was scheduled to pass through Henderson before noon, but nothing's shown on the line. Regional dispatch claims it's “in transit” but won’t confirm if it even left the yard over in California. What a mess.

Had to bump the route again - third time this month. I’ve got four drivers sitting idle and management breathing down my neck about fuel rations.

Rumors floating around that there was another lockdown at Nellis AFB. Someone said “routine drill,” but that’s the third one this week. Something’s up.

If they want to keep running black budget trains through my yard, they could at least let us know when one goes missing.

- R. Calhoun
translation:
【2077年10月22日】

主题：货运列车仍未寻获

优先列车依旧下落不明。按计划本应在午前经过亨德森站，但沿线始终未见其踪。区域调度中心坚称列车"正在运输中"，却连车辆是否驶离加州调车场都无法确认。简直一团糟。

现在不得不再次调整线路一一这是本月第三次了。现在有四名司机无货可运，管理层还在为燃油配额的事不断施压。

基地又传出封锁消息，有人说是"常规演习"，但这周都第三次了。肯定有蹊跷。

既然他们要在我管辖的调车场偷偷运营黑预算列车，那至少该在车辆失踪时通知我们一声。

一一R·卡尔霍恩

original:
To whoever finds this,

I can’t scrape together another day. Not here. Not anywhere.

North Vegas used to be home. Even after Mr. House took over and the NCR came. I told myself I’d stick it out. But it’s just… rot now. The streets are empty, the water’s foul, and every face I knew is either dead or wears a gun for a smile.

And then there’s that stupid Strip. All those lights, the music, the drunks with pockets full of caps. People laughing and drinking all night. I can see the glow from out the window at night and all the noise, like it’s mocking me. They get to forget. We get to starve. Can't even sleep.

I thought I could make something here. I patched walls, I fixed fences, I hauled junk for whoever had the caps. I kept my head down and waited for things to turn around. But they never do. They never will.

The NCR doesn’t care, House doesn’t care, the people over in Westside don't care and the Fiends care too much in the worst way.

If you’re reading this, take whatever's in here. It’s got to be worth a few caps at least. 

Me? I’m done trying.
translation:
致发现这封信的人：

我实在撑不下去了。在这里撑不下去，在任何地方都撑不下去了。

北维加斯曾经是我的家。即使在豪斯先生接管、NCR进驻之后，我仍告诉自己要坚持下去。但如今这里只剩......腐朽。街道空无一人，水源污浊不堪，我认识的每一张面孔，不是已经死去，就是挂着枪械当笑容。

还有那条可笑的长街。霓虹闪烁，乐声震天，醉醺醺的人口袋里装满了瓶盖。整夜纵情畅饮的人们一一每晚窗外透来的霓虹光影和喧嚣，都像在嘲弄我。他们可以忘记一切，我们只能挨饿等死。连安睡都成了奢望。

我曾以为能在这里拼出个未来。我修补过墙壁，修理过栅栏，为任何付得起瓶盖的人清理垃圾。我一直低着头忍耐，等待转机降临。但转机从未来临，也永远不会来临。

NCR不在乎，豪斯先生不在乎，西区的人不在乎，而恶魔帮却用最残忍的方式“在乎”过头。

如果你读到这封信，就把这里的东西都拿走吧。至少应该能换几个瓶盖。

至于我？
我已经受够了挣扎。

original:
Don't know why I'm writing this. Habit, maybe. They taught us to keep records, chain of command, daily logs, all that. But the radios have finally gone silent three days ago, and the last supply run never came back. It's just me now.

I locked up Engine 2. No more coolant.

First week was chaos. Cars jammed the roads, people screaming, power went out. I pulled more bodies than I care to count. It was panic all over. Fires, looting and folks turning on each other. You train for accidents, for disasters. But not for the end of the world.

We did our best. Captain Morales died trying to save a family trapped in a garage fire over on Eastside. Didn't even hesitate. He always said a fireman runs in when others run out. I wonder if he’d still say that now.

By week three, we stopped wearing uniforms. They made us targets. They see a badge or a helmet, they think you’re hoarding supplies, or that you’ve got some kind of authority left. I buried Jenkins behind the station. Shot in the back over a damn stimpak.

I’m not brave like the others. I’m tired. I’m leaving this note in case anyone finds it, in case anyone remembers we tried. That we didn’t run or hide. We stayed as long as we could.
translation:
不知为何还要写这些。或许是出于习惯吧。他们过去总教导我们要保留记录一一指挥链、值班日志，诸如此类。但无线电在三天前彻底静默了，最后一支补给队也再没回来。现在只剩我了。

我已经封存了2号消防车。冷却剂用完了。

第一周完全是地狱。街道被车辆堵死，到处是尖叫的人群，电力也中断了。我拖出的尸体多到不愿回忆。整座城市陷入疯狂一一烈火、抢劫、人与人互相残杀。我们受过处理事故的训练，应对灾难的训练。但没人教过我们如何面对世界末日。

我们尽了全力。莫拉莱斯队长为救东区车库火灾里的一家人牺牲了。他冲进去时没有丝毫犹豫。总说"消防员要逆着人潮前进"。不知他现在是否还会这么说。

到第三周，我们不再穿制服。那只会让我们成为靶子。人们看见徽章或头盔，就认定你私藏物资，还以为你手握权势。我把詹金斯葬在了消防局后面一一他为了一包该死的治疗针被人从背后开枪打死。

我不像其他人那么勇敢。真的累了。留下这封信，万一有人发现，万一还有人记得我们努力过。我们没有逃跑也没有躲藏。我们坚守到了最后一刻。

original:
I don’t know why I dragged myself in here. Maybe I thought I’d be safe.

The station’s gone to hell. Anderson’s dead. Took a brick to the head when they rushed the front. Dispatch stopped answering hours ago. I think the repeaters are down, or there’s no one left to call back.

I tried helping a kid caught in the crossfire. Got a knife in the gut for it. Hurts like hell. Tried to patch it but supplies are gone.

The city’s burning. No bombs here at least, just people. No orders, no backup, no goddamn help. The army pulled out this morning — saw their convoy rolling south like they couldn’t get out fast enough. I just don't know what to do anymore.

If anyone finds this, please tell my wife, Mari, that I tried. God help us all.
translation:
我也不知道为什么要挣扎着爬进来。或许只是觉得......这里会更安全些。

警局已经沦陷了。安德森牺牲了一一暴民冲前门时，他被砖块砸中了头部。调度中心几小时前就没了回应，估计是中继站瘫痪了，也可能......已经没人能回应了。

我试图救那个交火中受伤的孩子，却被人捅了肚子。剧痛难忍，想包扎却发现医疗物资早已用尽。

整座城市在燃烧。至少这儿还没落炸弹，但人类比炸弹更可怕。没有指令，没有支援，他妈的什么都没有。今早军队也撤走了一一看着他们的车队仓皇南逃，仿佛慢一步就会万劫不复。我真的不知道......还能做什么。

倘若有人发现这些字迹，请转告我妻子玛丽：我尽力了。愿上帝怜悯我们所有人。

original:
[Jul 19th, 2076]

Subject: Incoming military shipment

Received confirmation: Sierra Railways has secured a new logistics contract with REPCONN and Poseidon Energy. Top priority cargo scheduled for monthly delivery, eastbound to Speedway Armory and “Site 89.” No details provided. All manifests marked “CLASSIFIED -- DOD CLEARANCE ONLY.”

Extra guards requested. Probably just another batch of laser or plasma weaponry. No big deal.

- R. Calhoun
translation:
【2076年7月19日】

主题：军方货运即将抵达

已确认：塞拉铁路公司与雷普康公司及波塞冬能源签订了新物流合同。每月将有一批最高优先级货物东运至斯皮德韦军械库及"89号基地"，所有货运清单均标注"机密一一仅限国防部权限"。

已申请增派安保人员。估计又是激光或等离子武器之类的常规运输。不必大惊小怪。

一一R·卡尔霍恩

original:
[Aug 10, 2077]

Subject: Cargo Incident - Manifest Discrepancy

One of the sealed cars came back with nothing listed on the return manifest - but the weight registered 4 tons heavier than it left. We're not supposed to ask questions, but this stinks of black budget stuff. HQ said to “log it and forget it.”

I copied the load ID and stuck it on my private file. Better safe than sorry.

- R. Calhoun
translation:
【2077年8月10日】

主题：货运事故 - 清单异常

有个密封车厢返程时清单显示空载一一但称重比出发时多了四吨。按规定我们不该过问，但这明显涉及黑预算项目。总部指示"登记归档即可"。

我偷偷记下了载货编号存进私人档案。有备无患。

一一R·卡尔霍恩

original:

original:
-- UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS --

-- AUTOMATED SYSTEM ALERT --

A non-authorized login attempt was made on Terminal #2B at 02:14AM. 

Attempt failed.

Access to Priority Route S-Blackout has been suspended pending further review.
translation:
-- 未授权访问 --

-- 系统自动警报 --

凌晨2点14分检测到2B号终端存在非授权登录尝试。

尝试未成功。

通往S-断电路线的优先通道访问权限已被暂停，等待进一步核查。

original:
This has grown into quite the motley collection. I’ve gathered many pieces - paintings, frames, little treasures from parishioners who no longer wanted them, or could no longer afford to keep them safe. Preservation, at least to this extent, wasn’t my original intention, but alas. The Good Book says “Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt…”, and yet, here I am, tucking them away in the dark.

These walls may one day crumble, but until then, something of God's children is spared from the Apocalypse. Every canvas here is a prayer in its own right. Not to God, perhaps - He has enough prayers already - but to those that follow. To remind them that we were once more than soldiers, more than politicians, more than desperate animals with our hands around each other’s throats. “Where there is no vision, the people perish.” These works, these fragile remnants, are vision enough.

If there’s a tomorrow, and humanity claws its way into it, I hope these works will speak. I hope whoever remains will understand that we were something more, before the end. And if there’s no tomorrow - well, God knows I tried. 

- Reverend O’Leary, October 23, 2077
translation:
不知不觉竟收集了这么多杂七杂八的东西。从教区居民那儿得来的画作、相框、小玩意儿一一他们或是不再想要，或是无力保全。我本没打算当个收藏家，至少不曾想规模至此。圣经明明告诫"不要为自己积攒财宝在地上，只要有衣有食，就当知足"......可如今，我却把这些物件藏在暗处。

这堵墙或许终将倾颓，但在那之前，总该为上帝的儿女留存些什么。这里的每幅画都是祈祷，或许不是对上帝的祈祷一一祂已听过太多一一而是对后来者的祈愿。愿他们知晓，人类曾不只是士兵、政客、互相撕咬的困兽。"没有异象，民就消亡。"这些脆弱的遗存，便是足够的异象。

倘若明天还会到来，倘若人类还能蹒跚前行，愿这些作品仍能诉说。愿幸存者明白，在终结降临前，我们曾创造过更珍贵的东西。若明天终究不会到来一一也罢，上帝见证过我尽力而为。

一一奥利里神父
2077年10月23日

original:
CLOSED

Cleaned this place up some fifteen years ago with my and my pappy's hands. NCR shitbirds come and take it over cause of the fucking Legion. Pappy's urn is still in there and they won't let me get it! Everything we worked for, everything pappy left me, my whole life was in here. They even took the fucking Sunset machine I refurbished. Motherfuckers! Fuck you! Suck my dick you gormless bastards!

- P.G. Cleary, former owner.
translation:
停业

十五年前我和老爹亲手把这儿收拾出来。NCR那帮杂碎因为该死的军团打过来就强占了我的地盘！老爹的骨灰坛还在里面，他们竟敢不让我进去拿！我们奋斗的一切，老爹留给我的所有，我这辈子的心血全在这儿了。连我亲手翻新的夕阳牌汽水机都被他们吞了！狗娘养的！操你祖宗！舔老子屌去吧没眼色的龟孙子！

一一前业主 P·G·克利里

original:
April 16th, 2280

Finally did it. Shelves are up, locks are on the doors, and the sign out front reads bold: RENNER’S PAWN. It ain’t the Silver Rush, but it doesn’t need to be. They sell firepower - I sell everything else. Pots, radios, busted clocks, ammo, even a few guns if the price is right. Freeside’s a river spilling into East Vegas, always hungry, always moving, and I catch what drifts downstream.

Business is steady, and already I’ve got regulars. A couple of those Kings offloading their “confiscations,” drunks pawning their own boots for a night at the Wrangler, even a Gun Runner tech hunting radio parts. They walk in because I’ve got what they need, and they pay what I ask. If they don’t, they leave - and then circle back when the wasteland reminds them of their place. So it goes.

Marta fusses at the counter, lining things up like it matters. Maybe it does. Maybe people like to believe the world isn’t chaos when they see neat shelves. She says I should slow down, but I didn’t claw my way up from nothing just to rest. This shop is mine. My crown on the heap. For once in my life, I’m the man in charge. God damn, it feels good.
translation:
2280年4月16日

总算搞定了。货架装好了，门锁换新了，门口招牌写得明明白白一一"雷纳的典当行"。比不上银衣怪客的排场，但咱不追求那个。他们卖军火，我这儿什么都收。锅碗瓢盆、收音机、破钟表、弹药，价钱合适连枪也收。自由城像条河往东维加斯淌，永远饥肠辘辘，永远奔流不息，而我专门打捞沉在河底的玩意儿。

生意挺稳当，已经有了熟客。几个飞车党来销赃，醉鬼为进赌场连靴子都典当，甚至有个枪械工匠来找无线电零件。他们进门是因为我这儿有他们要的东西，开价多少都得认。不认？请便一一等废土教他们做人之后，自然又会灰溜溜回来。世道就这样。

玛塔在柜台前忙活，把东西摆得整整齐齐。或许真有必要。当人们看见整齐的货架时，大概会愿意相信这世界还没彻底疯掉。她总劝我别太拼，可我好不容易从泥坑里爬出来，难道就为了躺着晒太阳？这铺子是我的。垃圾山上的王冠。活到今天，总算能自己说了算。
妈的，这感觉真不赖。

original:
April 22nd, 2280

Trouble. Some gangers have been harrassing me. First time they strolled in, all swagger and scorpion patches, said they were offering “protection.” Protection from what? I told them I had my own protection under the counter, six shells waiting.  One of them leaned too close to Marta, so I leaned closer back, hand on the grip. They got the message and left. Thought about cracking one across the jaw to drive it home.

Didn’t take long before they scrawled their tails all over my wall, paint dripping like venom. Half-dry by the time I found it. Spent half an hour scrubbing while Marta wrung her hands. Neighbors saw it, and customers started giving my place that wide-eyed look like just walking through the door meant they were next. Cowards.

Today they came again, bold as ever, one grinning like a ghoul. Said I “owed” for the last visit, and it’d be cheaper to pay now before things got worse. I told him my plan: I won't pay them a goddamn thing. If they want something from me, they’ll have to take it from my hands. He smirked, tapped his knife on the counter, and left. Marta’s pale with worry. Me? I’ve seen worse in Reno. You don’t survive by folding to skinny leather-wearing tweakers.
translation:
2280年4月22日

麻烦上门了。几个帮派混混整天来骚扰。头一回他们大摇大摆走进来，浑身蝎子标志，说要提供"保护"。防谁？我直接亮出台面下的霰弹枪，六发子弹候着。有个崽子凑玛塔太近，我立刻贴上去按住枪柄。他们撂下狠话走了，当时真该砸烂谁的下巴立威。

结果没过两天，他们就用油漆在我墙上涂满蜈蚣似的标记，黏稠液体像毒液般往下淌。发现时颜料半干，我擦洗了半个钟头，玛塔站在旁边绞着手。邻居们都看见了，顾客进门时都瞪大眼睛，仿佛踏进这店就会惹祸上身。一群懦夫。

今天他们又来了，领头的咧着张尸鬼似的笑脸，说我该为上次"表示表示"，现在破财消灾还来得及。我告诉他：老子一分钱都不会给。想要什么，只管从老子手里抢。那杂碎用刀尖敲敲柜台，冷笑着走了。玛塔吓得脸色发白。而我呢？我在里诺什么阵仗没见过。我要是对这群穿皮衣的瘾君子低头，是根本活不到今天的。

original:
April 28th, 2280

Business is thinning out. Even the regulars avoid eye contact now, hurrying past like the scorpion tag carved on my wall might sting them just for looking. That’s how these gangs work - they make people afraid, and fear does the work for them. But I didn’t claw my way up just to let some punks starve me out. 

Things looked up for a moment. Got to talking with a couple of Kings guarding the Freeside gate - they’d heard how I stared down the Scorpions. Said we’re cut from the same cloth, the sort who don’t take shit from anyone. They were desperate for biomedical gel, and I had a whole crate some prospector pawned me months back. One deal later, I had a haul fat enough to close the place for half a year. Not that I ever would. Renner’s doesn’t close for anyone.

Marta doesn’t see it that way. She cried tonight, begged me to move near her sister in Westside, said this shop isn’t worth dying for. She doesn’t understand. Every cap, every deal, every cut and bruise I took was to build this place — for her, for us. If the Scorpions think they can scare me off, they picked the wrong man. I’ll pay them in buckshot before I pay them in caps. She didn’t like that answer. One day she’ll see I was right.

And then today, those bastards just walked in and lifted a rifle off the wall like it was theirs. I told them to drop it. One of them laughed and said I should be glad they didn’t take Marta instead. I nearly put a round in his back, but there were three of them, and... I wasn’t about to start a war I couldn’t finish. For now, I let it go. For now.
translation:
2280年4月28日

生意越来越冷清。连老主顾都躲着眼神走，仿佛墙上的蝎子标记多看一眼就会蜇人。这就是混混们的把戏一一散播恐惧，让恐惧替他们干活。但我从泥潭里爬出来，可不是为了让这群杂种断我生路。

转机来得意外。我和守自由城大门的飞车党聊了聊，他们一听说我硬刚毒蝎帮的事，就说我们是同类一一都不吃欺压的那套。他们急需生物医疗胶，我正好有整箱探险者典当的存货。一锤子买卖，赚的够歇业半年。虽然我绝不会关店一一雷纳的典当行不为任何人关门。

玛塔不这么想。她今晚哭着求我搬去西区她姐姐那儿，说这铺子不值得送命。她不懂。每个瓶盖每笔交易每次受伤，都是为了这个家一一为她，为我们。毒蝎帮想吓退我？找错人了。老子宁愿喂他们吃枪子也不会交半个瓶盖。她听不进去。总有一天会明白我是对的。

更可恨的是今天，那群杂种直接闯进来从墙上摘走一把步枪，跟拿自己东西似的。我吼着让他们放下。有个混账笑着说没把玛塔掳走就算我走运。我当时差点扣扳机，但他们有三个人...总不能打没把握的仗。暂时忍了。只是暂时。

original:
May 3rd, 2280

Enough’s enough. Customer told me the Followers warn people not to come to the shop. Too dangerous. I barred the windows, braced the back door, and strung up little surprises all over — bottles on wire, trip lines on the stairs, sandbags under the counter to soak up pistol fire. Shotgun’s loaded with dragon’s breath, pistols stashed in reach of every corner. This isn’t just a shop anymore. It’s a fortress.

Marta begged me to quit, to leave it all behind, but I told her a man who won’t defend what’s his isn’t a man at all. My whole life’s been spent pawing through other people’s ruins. I’ll be damned if I let them make a ruin of mine.

The other night I heard scratching outside and sat up with the shotgun across my lap till dawn. Nothing came. Maybe they don’t have the guts. Marta barely slept, but I told her that just means the deterrents are working. Fear cuts both ways.

Now I sit behind the counter like a king on his throne, walls strong around me. The Scorpions thought I’d roll over. They were wrong. I’ve lost some customers, but I never lost my pride. This place is mine, and no one’s taking it. Not while I’m breathing. No, I locked the wasteland out, I conquered that bullshit once and for all. Everyone's gonna talk about Renner's years from now as the place, the man, that finally did it. Things are finally going the right way.
translation:
2280年5月3日

该做个了断了。有顾客说追随者协会警告人们别来我这儿，说太危险。我封死窗户，加固后门，到处设了"小惊喜"一一铁丝串空瓶，楼梯布绊索，柜台里塞满防弹沙袋。霰弹枪装满龙息弹，每个角落都藏了手枪。这儿不再是典当行，是堡垒。

玛塔求我收手，放弃这一切。但我告诉她，连自己东西都守不住的男人不配叫男人。我这辈子都在废墟里扒食，绝不容许谁把我的心血变成废墟。

我前天夜里听见外面有动静，于是就抱着霰弹枪坐到天亮了。最后什么都没发生一一看来他们也没种。玛塔吓得没合眼，我说这说明防线起作用了。恐惧是把双刃刀。

此刻我像君王坐在柜台后，坚固墙壁是我的王座。毒蝎帮以为我会屈服？他们错了。我损失了些顾客，但没丢掉尊严。这地方属于我，只要还有一口气，谁也别想夺走。不，我把废土锁在了门外，一劳永逸地征服了这狗屎世道。多年后人们会传颂雷纳的典当行的故事，传颂那个最终做到这一切的男人。一切终于走上正轨了。

original:
[Oct 17th, 2077]

From: Regional HQ - First Mojave Savings
To: Branch Manager, Henderson
SUBJECT: URGENT - Emergency Government Order

Effective immediately, you are to surrender all bullion and currency reserves in vault storage to the United States Army, 11th Armored Cavalry Regiment. This includes, but is not limited to:

All gold bars and coins.

All silver reserves.

Federal Reserve cash shipments in your possession.

Military personnel will arrive within 24 hours to take custody of these assets. You are to provide full cooperation and maintain strict confidentiality. Discussion of this requisition with customers or the public is considered a breach of national security under the Emergency Banking & Resource Reallocation Act (Public Law 87-17).

Thank you for your patriotism during this time of crisis.

“For America’s Future - Safe, Secure, Prepared.”

- U.S. Army Quartermaster Liaison
translation:
【2077年10月17日】

发件人：第一莫哈维储蓄银行区域总部
收件人：亨德森分行经理
主题：紧急 - 政府紧急征用令

即刻起，请将金库内储存的所有金银及货币储备移交至美国陆军第11装甲骑兵团。具体包括但不限于：

所有金条与金属货币

所有白银储备

由贵行保管的联邦储备银行现钞运输箱

军方人员将在24小时内抵达接收上述资产。贵行须全力配合并严格保密。根据《紧急银行与资源调配法案》（第87-17号公法），向客户或公众透露本次征用信息将视为危害国家安全。

感谢您在此危机时刻展现的爱国精神。

"为了美国的未来一一安全、稳固、有备无患。"

一一美国陆军军需联络官

original:
[Oct 19th, 2077]

The Army boys came by this morning, all business, rifles and dark glasses. Hauled every last bar and bill out of here like they owned the place. Said it was “for the war effort.”

Sure, the war’s still on and Alaska might be ours again, but our boys are dying in Tsingtao, and half a dozen other places I can’t even spell. But gold? What’s that going to do on the front lines? You can’t shoot it, you can’t eat it. Feels like someone is lining their pockets while waving the flag.

I slipped two gold bars out of the main stack while they were distracted with the manifest. Put them in Safety Deposit Box 1204. Not on the books.

I’ll sleep better knowing I’ve got something stashed away if the world goes to hell. Kept a spare key in a safe back at my apartment. Might never need it, but… just in case.

If nothing happens, maybe I’ll feel guilty. If something does… well, then I’ll be the smartest man in Vegas.
translation:
【2077年10月19日】

那帮当兵的今天早上来了，穿着制服戴着墨镜，个个端着步枪公事公办的模样。他们把这里每根金条每沓钞票都搬了个精光，架势跟搬自己家东西似的。说是"为了战争需要"。

是啊，战争还在打，阿拉斯加也许已经收复了。可我们的小伙子正在青岛送命一一还有六七个我连名字都拼不出来的鬼地方。但黄金？这玩意儿在前线能顶什么用？既不能当枪使，又不能当饭吃。感觉就像有人一边挥舞国旗，一边往自己口袋里捞好处。

他们核对清单的时候，我趁机从主堆里摸了两根金条出来。藏进了1204号保险箱，账面上绝对查不到。

想到在这乱世里还留着点家底，我今晚总算能睡个安稳觉。公寓保险柜里备了把备用钥匙。也许永远用不上...但留着总归没错。

要是天下太平，日后我或许会良心不安。要是世道真垮了...嘿，到时候我可就是维加斯最精明的明白人。【2077年10月19日】

那帮当兵的今天早上来了，穿着制服戴着墨镜，个个端着步枪公事公办的模样。他们把这里每根金条每沓钞票都搬了个精光，架势跟搬自己家东西似的。说是"为了战争需要"。

是啊，战争还在打，阿拉斯加也许已经收复了。可我们的小伙子正在青岛送命一一还有六七个我连名字都拼不出来的鬼地方。但黄金？这玩意儿在前线能顶什么用？既不能当枪使，又不能当饭吃。感觉就像有人一边挥舞国旗，一边往自己口袋里捞好处。

他们核对清单的时候，我趁机从主堆里摸了两根金条出来。藏进了1204号保险箱，账面上绝对查不到。

想到在这乱世里还留着点家底，我今晚总算能睡个安稳觉了。公寓保险柜里备了把备用钥匙。也许永远用不上...但留着总归没错。

要是天下太平，日后我或许会良心不安。要是世道真垮了...嘿，到时候我可就是维加斯最精明的明白人。

original:
[Oct 22st, 2077]

Slow day today. Hardly any customers. Folks are either too broke or too nervous to make deposits lately. Can’t blame them with all the war talk on the news.

Got a letter from my sister in Reno. Says they’re rationing coffee now and she’s down to two cups a week. Told her to come stay with me for a while if things get worse. Vegas feels safer than most places. Bright lights, busy casinos… you’d never know there’s a war on if you stayed on the Strip.

The spare key’s still safe at home. I keep telling myself I won’t need it, but it’s nice knowing it’s there. If the war drags on another year or two, maybe I’ll cash in those bars and take a long vacation.

Caught a War Department broadcast this morning. Some general promising “a decisive push in the Pacific” and “total victory in sight.” Guess we’ll see if that changes anything. Personally, I think it’s all going to blow over sooner or later. Life goes on.
translation:
【2077年10月22日】

今天格外冷清。最近来办业务的人寥寥无几一一不是穷得叮当响，就是被战争消息吓得不敢存钱。也怪不得他们，新闻里整天都是战事报道。

我收到了在里诺的姐姐的来信，她说那边开始咖啡配给制了，每周只能喝上两杯。我回信说如果情况恶化，可以暂时搬来和我同住。维加斯总归比别处安全些一一霓虹璀璨的赌场街永远人声鼎沸，只要待在长街上，你根本察觉不到正在打仗。

那把备用钥匙还好好收在家里。虽然我一直说服自己用不上它，但知道有这条后路总是心安。要是战争再拖个一两年，说不定我会把金条兑现，找个地方度个长假。

今早收听到陆军部的广播，某位将军信誓旦旦宣称"将在太平洋战区发动决定性攻势"，"胜利曙光在望"。且看这番豪言壮语能改变什么吧。依我看，这场风波迟早会平息。日子总得过下去。

original: Climb Ladder to The Freeside Gate
translation: 通往自由城大门的梯子

original: Our Lady of Hope Hospital 2nd Lvl

translation: 加利福尼亚州公路巡逻站
探照灯营地教堂地下室
南维加斯废墟西部入口
打开天启追随者哨站门
进入海耶斯中尉的帐篷
加利福尼亚州公路巡逻站

original:
This generator would provide power to Quarry Junction, if it were functional. It seems to have fallen into disrepair due to years of decay and neglect. Someone with the proper knowledge could easily get the generator operational.

[Repair of 35 or greater required to fix the generator.]
translation:
这台发电机本可为采石场枢纽供电，但目前处于故障状态。由于常年荒废与缺乏维护，设备已严重老化。若具备相关技术知识，要让它恢复运转并非难事。

[修复发电机需要35点或以上修理。]
